message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.NI

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses the performance of Reed-Muller codes on the packet erasure channel, which is a topic related to information theory. 
2. cs.CC (Computational Complexity) - The paper discusses the complexity of decoding Reed-Muller codes and proposes improvements to reduce the decoding complexity. 
3. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper proposes a new encoding/decoding scheme for Reed-Muller codes on the packet erasure channel based on Plotkin construction, which is related to data structures and algorithms. 
4. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) - The paper discusses the performance of Reed-Muller codes on the packet erasure channel, which is a topic related to communication networks. 
5. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper discusses the performance of Reed-Muller codes on the packet erasure channel, which is a topic related to networking and internet architecture.
